definition: to abstain from/to prohibit (certain foods etc)
to guard against/to exhort/to admonish or warn/to give up or stop doing sth/Buddhist monastic discipline/ring (for a finger)

sentences.english: Abstain from all appearance of evil.
sentences.chinese: 各样的恶事要禁戒不作。

sentences.english: You are to abstain from food sacrificed to idols, from blood, from the meat of strangled animals and from sexual immorality.
sentences.chinese: 就是禁戒祭偶像的物，和血，并勒死的牲畜，和奸淫。

sentences.english: Abstain from every form of evil.
sentences.chinese: 各样的恶事要禁戒不做。

sentences.english: Maybe I'll go on a venting fast that lasts the rest of my life.
sentences.chinese: 也许我将来会去一辈子都发泄禁戒。

sentences.english: Jesus warned them not to tell anyone about him.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣就禁戒他们，不要告诉人。

sentences.english: If you think that a venting fast requires willpower, you're half right.
sentences.chinese: 如果你认为一个发泄禁戒需要意志力，你只对了一半。

sentences.english: 29You are to abstain from food sacrificed to idols, from blood, from the meat of strangled animals and from sexual immorality.
sentences.chinese: 就是禁戒祭偶像的物，和血，并勒死的牲畜，和奸淫。

sentences.english: All results can be used to explain the spin-forbidden levels in spectra.
sentences.chinese: 结果很好地解释了自旋禁戒跃迁能级的光谱现象。

definition: to go against the rules (of a religious order)/to break a ban (e.g. medical)
(Buddhism) to adhere strictly to the ethical precepts/asceticism
